1.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Rachel has just gotten home and is going through the mail.
She finds something that's Monica's and goes over and knocks on her closed bedroom door.

lines.Line: (In a sexy voice) Come in. I've been waiting for you.
Rachel enters.
Rachel enters.

Hi! I just wanna-(sees Monica)-Ahhh!!! Oh my God! (She runs out in
horror.) Oh my God

(pulling on a robe) Okay, I'm sorry! I'm sorry! I-I-I was um, I was
taking a nap

Since when do take naps in that position. Oh God Monica, tell me
you were waiting for a guy! Please tell me you were waiting for a guy

Yes. Yes, I was. A guy. From work. (Thinks) I'm seeing a guy from work!
Ha

Yes. Yes, I was. A guy. From work. (Thinks) I'm seeing a guy from work!
Ha

(Gasps) That cute waiter guy from your restaurant, the one that looks
like a non-threatening Ray Liotta
Uh-huh, that one
Uh-huh, that one

Y'know what, just give me a second and I'll be out of your hair. I'm
just gonna grab a jacket. When I get back, I want every little detail. (There's a knock on
the door.) Maybe that's him. (Goes to answer the door.

(Panicking) Okay, umm, okay, umm… (Rachel opens the door.) It's
just Joey and Ross
Why aren't you guys at the movie
Why aren't you guys at the movie

Well, we were! But Ross was talking so loud on his phone they threw us
out
I had to talk loud because the movie was loud
I had to talk loud because the movie was loud
(to Monica and Rachel) He's talking to London
But why?! Did he get in touch with Emily
But why?! Did he get in touch with Emily

Well no, not yet. He's calling everyone on her side of the family hoping
that someone will help him get in touch with her

(on phone) I-I-I don't care if I said some other girl's name you prissy,
old twit
Ross! Way to suck up to the family
Ross! Way to suck up to the family

(entering, happily, with a bottle of champagne, thinking that Monica
is the only one there) Ha-ha-ha-(sees everyone)-enh-enh. I'm so glad you guys are all
here! My office finally got wrinkle free fax paper

2.SceneDescription: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Rachel are there.

lines.Line: So Chandler, have you heard about Monica's secret boyfriend
Uhh, yeah. She uh, she uh, she uh might've mentioned him
So Mon, when are we gonna meet this new secret waiter man

Ohh, he's really shy. I-I don’t think he's up to meeting everyone
yet
Yeah, I don't think he's up to meeting everyone yet
Yeah, I don't think he's up to meeting everyone yet

I don’t care! I wanna meet this guy who's the best sex she ever
had

lines.Character: (Chandler is quite pleased with that statement
lines.Line: Chandler is quite pleased with that statement.

lines.Character: (Chandler is quite pleased with that statement
lines.Line: Chandler is quite pleased with that statement.
Really?! That's what you heard? (To Monica) You said that
I might've said that. (Chandler laughs.) Why is that funny

Because I'm very happy for him! (To Monica) And you, you lucky
dog
(entering) Hi
(entering) Hi
(entering) Hi
(entering) Hi
(entering) Hi
Hey
Hey
Hey
Hey
Well, Emily's willing to work on the relationship
Yes
Yes
Yes
Yes
That's great
In London
In London
In London
What?
What?
What?
She wants me to move to London
But you live here! (Ross rolls his eyes.) You know that
What-what-what are you gonna do
What-what-what are you gonna do

I bet if I talk to Carol and Susan I can convince them to move to London
with Ben

Yeah, I'm sure your ex-wife will be more than happy to move to another
country so you can patch things up with your new wife
It could happen
It could happen
It could happen
It could happen

3.SceneDescription: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Rachel, and Monica are there.

lines.Line:
I cannot believe I can't find a selfless good deed! Y'know that old guy
that lives next to me? Well, I snuck over there and-and raked up all the leaves on his
front stoop. But he caught me and force-fed me cider and cookies. Then I felt wonderful.
That old jackass
Maybe Joey's right. Maybe all good deeds are selfish

I will find a selfless good deed! 'Cause I just gave birth to three
children and I will not let them be raised in a world where Joey is right
(entering) Hey, Monica? Can I ask you a cooking question
(entering) Hey, Monica? Can I ask you a cooking question
Sure
Sure

If you're cooking on the stove, does that mean that your new secret
boyfriend is better in bed than Richard
Chandler! (Pause) Is he
Chandler! (Pause) Is he

Well, y'know I-I-I think I'm gonna respect the privacy of my new secret
boyfriend

Why?! I mean if this guy was me and it was me who had
learned that it was me who was the best you'd ever had, I'd be going like this. (He
jumps up onto the table and starts doing his happy dance.

4.SceneDescription:
Monica and Rachel's, Ross is telling Phoebe, Monica, and Chandler about Emily's
ultimatum.

lines.Line: So I asked Emily if she would come to New York, and she said yes
Yes
Yes
Yes
Ooh-ohh
Ooh-ohh
Great
Great
No-no-no! Only if I promise never to see Rachel again
Why
Why
Why
Why
Why
What?! You can't—what did you tell her

I told her I'd have to think about it. I mean, how the hell am I supposed
to make this kind of a decision? (They're all quiet.) I'm actually asking you

Well, you can't just not see Rachel anymore, she's one of your best
friends
Yeah! But, he can't not exactly see Emily, I mean that's his wife
Yeah! But, he can't not exactly see Emily, I mean that's his wife
Yeah
Yeah
Yeah
That's true
That's true

Yeah, but you've known Rachel since High School and you cannot just cut
her out of your life
That's true
That's true
That's true
No, you cannot
No, you cannot
Thanks for the help, problem solved. (Wipes his hands.
The phone rings.
The phone rings.
The phone rings.
(answering it) Hello
(on phone) Hey Mon
(on phone) Hey Mon
Oh hey Joey! We've been watching all day, when are you gonna be on TV

See, there was kind of a mix up in my agent's office, but I'm still on TV
and that's good exposure.
(Looking at the TV) You're not on TV
(Looking at the TV) You're not on TV

Oh, uh, okay, how, how about now? (He waves his hand in front of the woman
next to him and you can now see his arm on TV.
Hey, there he is! There he is
Hey, there he is! There he is
Hello New York! (The woman bats his hand out of the way.

5.SceneDescription: The Telethon, Joey's phone rings and he answers it.

lines.Line: (in a bored voice) PBS telethon

(on phone from Central Perk) Hey Joey, I just wanted to let you know
that I found a selfless good deed. I just went down to the park and I let a bee sting me
What?! What good is that gonna do anybody
What?! What good is that gonna do anybody

Well, it helps the bee look tough in front of his bee friends. The bee
is happy and I am definitely not
Now, y'know the bee probably died after he stung ya
(Thinks for a moment.) Aw, dammit! (Slams the phone down.
Back on in 30 seconds people
Back on in 30 seconds people

lines.Character: (Joey gets up and moves to the other end of his row to talk to the guy sitting there
lines.Line: Joey gets up and moves to the other end of his row to talk to the guy sitting there.
Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me
Hey, excuse me, would you mind switching with me
Hey, no way, I'm in the shot man
Come on man! You've been here all day
Come on man! You've been here all day
Yeah, I-I'm taking pledges here, eh
We're on in 3, 2, (points to Gary Collins.

Welcome back to our fall telethon. Now if you've been enjoying the performance of Cirque Du Soleil, (As he is speaking, Joey and the volunteer getting into a shoving match.) and you'd like to see more of the same kind of programming, it's very simple. All you have to do (Joey is knocked down.) is call in your pledge and at that time tell the operator, one of our volunteers, what kind of programming you'd like to… (Just as the volunteer sits down, Joey pulls him to the ground.

6.SceneDescription: The Telethon, Joey answers his ringing phone.

lines.Line: (in an unenthusiastic voice) PBS Telethon
(on phone) Hi Joey
(on phone) Hi Joey
Hey Pheebs
Hey Pheebs
I would like to make a pledge. I would like to donate $200
$200? Are you sure Pheebs? I mean, after what Sesame Street did to ya

Oh, I'm still mad at them but I also now that they bring happiness to
lots of kids who's moms didn't kill themselves, so by supporting them, I'm doing a good
thing, but I'm not happy about it. So there, a selfless good deed
And you don't a little good about donating the money
And you don't a little good about donating the money
No, it sucks. I was saving up to buy a hamster
No, it sucks. I was saving up to buy a hamster
A hamster? What, those things are like 10 bucks
Yeah, not the one I had my eye on

(on TV.) It looks like we have surpassed last year's pledge total!
Thank you viewers! The pledge that did it was taken by one of our volunteers…(He
walks over to where Joey is sitting.) Oh boy! And may I say one of our sharpest dressed
volunteers, (Joey stands up.) Mr. Joseph Tribbiani

Oh, look-look, Joey's on TV! Isn't that great? My pledge got Joey on TV!
Oh that makes me feel—Oh no! (Realizes that her deed made her happy and therefore
it's selfish and covers her mouth in horror.

7.SceneDescription:
Ross's apartment, Ross is prying at the Magic 8 Ball with a screwdriver as
there's a knock on his door which he goes to answer.

lines.Line: (entering) Hi! Are you ready? We're gonna be late
For what
For what
For what
For Stella! Remember? She's gettin' her grove back in like 20 minutes

Yeah, I uh, totally forgot about that. You mind if I take a rain check?
I'm waiting for a call from Emily
Sure. I guess. Hey, I hear you don't have to go to London. Yay
It's not that easy, there's still a lot of relationship stuff
It's not that easy, there's still a lot of relationship stuff
Like what
Like what
Just stuff. Y'know kinda what Emily wants
Well, why don't you talk to me about it, maybe I can help

No. No. You-you can't help. I mean, I kinda have to do this without your
help

Well, I-I know you can do that too. I'm just, I'm just saying if you
need somebody to talk to… Hi
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks
Thanks

Ross? Look, whatever this relationship stuff that Emily wants, just give
it to her. Come on, the bottom line here is that you love her. So just fix whatever she
wants fixed. Just do it. (The phone starts ringing.) I mean, you're gonna have to
try. You'll just gonna hate yourself if you don't. (The phone keeps ringing.) Oh come on
answer it! It's driving me crazy

(answering the phone.) Hello. (Listens) Hi sweetie. (Listens.) Good. Look
umm, yes I've been thinking about that thing that you wanted me to do and, I can do it.
(Rachel gives him a thumbs up.) So will you come to New York? (Rachel wants to know what
she said, and he gives her a thumbs up and she goes over and hugs him. All the time not
knowing what's going on.
